column4: Ok, I have to say it:   Karmic should not have been released.
is it about the cracks you hear through the speakers?
stutters under even brief CPU spikes, sometimes sound freezes entirely while the CPU hog in question is running
The machine in question worked fine under Jaunty.
no, it's occasional "pops" in the sound, while playing music.
My best guess after much googling is that it's a kernel bug in the CPU frequency scaler routines.
So now I'm backing the kernel down to 2.6.28-5, something I know for sure worked under Jaunty
Don't quote that stuff to me, please
I've been all over the forums and the web in general
My fault: I should have mentioned, I'm a seasoned Linux user with some 10 years' experience.
yet this is just outside of my limited skills.
but only when you play music? No 'pop' when an application starts to make a sound?
that is correct - it's like someone's sitting there tapping the "skip forward" button on the music every once in a while
